alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 6:33PM EDT until August 04 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 630 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Emergency Management reported Johns Creek in the Meta area is out of its banks, and several other creeks in north central Pike county are at or near bank full. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Zebulon, Coal Run, Raccoon, Chloe, Meta, Boldman, Osborn, Harold, Betsy Layne, Justell, Aluba, Kimper, Grethel, Galveston, Sidney, Honaker, Craynor and Canada.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
